revised_title: Wave Resistance of a Ship: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations
tldr: This article investigates the wave resistance of a ship advancing in still water and how it is affected by the position of the ship among waves. The author presents a theoretical approach to calculate the additional resistance due to free surface waves and applies it to a model ship. The results show that the resistance can be reduced by up to 30% depending on the ship's position relative to the waves. The study also considers the case of a ship advancing through transverse waves moving with the appropriate velocity for their wavelength.
